alignments.name: ABSNC Standards - STANDARD 6 - Eligibility Criteria
alignments.description: Eligibility criteria should be based on a series of variables indicative of knowledge, skills, and abilities required for specialty practice and expected to enhance safe and effective practice. These variables may include education, experience, prerequisite credentials and performance on an objective examination.

alignments.name: ABSNC Standards - STANDARD 7 - Validity
alignments.description: A passing score on a certification examination indicates the nurse has the knowledge to practice in the nursing specialty at the level indicated by the test. This implication is valid only if the test actually measures knowledge of the specialty and the passing score represents an appropriate level of performance.

alignments.name: ABSNC Standards - STANDARD 7 - Validity
alignments.description: Evidence of validity is a determination that the content and format of the test are based on the behavioral domain of the nursing specialty. Content validity is supported if the test measures the intended content areas and level of knowledge, the test format is appropriate, and the content of the test questions is accurate.

badge_template_activities.title: To apply for the certification exam a candidate must create and account with the Competency and Credentialing Institute which administers the certification. To complete the online application, the following information is required: • Personal contact information • RN license information • Employer contact information • Supervisor contact information Further detail on the data needed for the application may be found on the CCI website. All fees must be paid in full prior to testing.
A current, unrestricted RN license in the state or country where current practice occurs.
Currently working full- or part-time in perioperative nursing, including nursing education, administration, research or clinical practice.
A minimum of 2 years and 2,400 hours of experience as a perioperative registered nurse (RN). A minimum of 50% (1,200 hours) of those hours must be in the intraoperative setting.

To earn the CNOR credential applicants must pass the certification examination covering the knowledge required to practice as a perioperative nurse. All examination questions have the same format; multiple choice questions, four possible answers with only correct answer. A score of 620 of 800 possible points is required for passing. The CNOR certification examination is developed in accordance with psychometric best practices and principles of the certification industry.

alignments.description: AORN believes there should be one level for entry into nursing practice. AORN believes the minimal preparation for entry into the practice of nursing should be the baccalaureate degree.

alignments.name: Value of Clinical Learning Activities in the Perioperative Setting in Undergraduate Nursing Curricular
alignments.description: AORN advocates for the inclusion of learning activities in the perioperative setting in all undergraduate professional nursing curricula. alignments.name: AORN Position Statement on Orientation of the Registered Nurse and Surgical Technologist to the Perioperative Setting
